abstract: Male residents of village of Fatehpur Beri, which lies on outskirts of New Delhi, are regularly employed to be bouncers at bars, a profession they are uniquely suited to as they come from long line of strongmen; villagers still retain many of their long-held traditions, such as exercise regimen for men and strict restrictions on women, and they have gradually adapted to changing circumstances as city expands.
lead_paragraph: There are few places where historical periods slam into each other quite so forcefully as they do outside New Delhi, where musclemen whose ancestors fought invaders now defend bar patrons.

headline.main: Old India’s Village of Warriors Becomes Birthplace of Bouncers
headline.print_headline: Old India’s Village of Warriors Becomes Birthplace of Bouncers
